name: Philodendron Verrucosum
climate: Thrives in a humid and warm environment, typical of tropical rainforests.
Prefers temperatures between 18°C to 30°C for optimal growth.
Avoid exposure to temperatures below 10°C as it can harm the plant.
Maintains good growth in a stable, warm indoor climate.
sunlight: Requires bright, indirect sunlight to flourish indoors.
Avoid exposing the plant to direct sunlight as it can scorch the leaves.
Can tolerate low light, but growth may be slower than in optimal conditions.
Ideal to find a spot with filtered sunlight for healthy foliage.
watering: Prefers consistently moist soil, so water it regularly.
Allow the top inch of soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure adequate drainage.
Decrease watering during the winter months when growth slows.
soil: Grows best in a well-aerated soil mix with good drainage.
Use a potting mix designed for tropical plants or aroid species.
Incorporate perlite or orchid bark to enhance airflow and drainage.
Avoid heavy soil mixtures as they can retain too much moisture.
toxic: Contains calcium oxalate crystals, which are toxic when ingested.
Can cause irritation or swelling in the mouth and throat if consumed.
extra_care_tip: Regularly clean the leaves to remove dust and enhance photosynthesis.
Maintain high humidity levels using a humidifier or pebble tray to mimic tropical conditions.
